==Japanese==
{{ja-kanjitab|yomi=o|ちょう|ぜつ}}

===Etymology===
{{IPAchar|/teuzetu/}} → {{IPAchar|/t͡ɕʲoːzet͡su/}}

From {{etyl|ltc|ja|sort=ちょうぜつ}} compound {{m|zh|超絕|tr=trhjew dzjwet|lit=to surpass + to cut off}}.  Compare modern {{etyl|cmn|-}} reading ''chāojué''.

===Pronunciation===
{{ja-pron|yomi=goon|ちょうぜつ|acc=0|acc_ref=DJR}}

===Adjective===
{{ja-adj|infl=na|ちょうぜつ|hhira=てうぜつ}}

# [[transcendant]], [[outstanding]], [[excellent]]

====Inflection====
{{ja-na|ちょうぜつ}}

====Usage notes====
The use of this term as an adjective appears to be a relatively recent development.  Many Japanese dictionaries do not list any adjectival senses for this term.<ref name="DJR">{{R:Daijirin}}</ref><ref name="KDJ">{{R:Kokugo Dai Jiten}}</ref><ref name="DJS">{{R:Daijisen}}</ref><ref name="SMK5">{{R:Shinmeikai5}}</ref>

===Noun===
{{ja-noun|ちょうぜつ|hhira=てうぜつ}}

# [[transcendance]], [[excellence]]

===Verb===
{{ja-verb-suru|ちょうぜつ|hhira=てうぜつ}}

# to [[transcend]], to [[stand out]], to [[excel]]

====Conjugation====
{{ja-suru|ちょうぜつ}}

====Usage notes====
The verb phrase is often used to to modify a noun as an [[adjectival]] [[phrase]], in both its [[present]] and [[perfective]] conjugations.
* {{ja-usex|凡俗を'''超絶する'''人物|ぼんぞく を '''ちょうぜつ する''' じんぶつ|a person who '''stands out from''' / '''transcends''' mediocrity}}
* {{ja-usex|'''超絶した'''名作|'''ちょうぜつ した''' めいさく|an '''outstanding''' masterpiece}}
